## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{R}
x <- 20
y <- 26

x+y

z <- 5*x
z

a <- 365
a

ls()

rm(a,z)

```

## Including Plots
Basic Plot
```{R}
a <- 1:10
a
length(a)
b <- c(26, 28, 30, 32, 34, 36, 38, 60, 42, 65)
length(b)

plot(a,b)
c <- seq(from=10, to=100, by=10)
c

points(a, c, col="red", pch=2)
lines(a,c,col="blue")

getwd()
```

Retrieve Individual Vector Elements
```{R}
b

b[5]

b<=50

b[b<=50]

which(b<=50)
```

Importing Data
```{R}
getwd()
setwd("~/Documents/R_Working_Directory")

data <- read.csv("gene_expression_example.csv", header = TRUE, sep=",")

names(data)

attach(data)

plot(log2(exprA), log2(exprB), col="blue")
```

Writing into files
```{R}
write.table(data, "output-data.csv", append = FALSE, col.names = TRUE,
            row.names = FALSE, quote = FALSE, sep = ",")

system("head -3 output-data.csv")

write.table(data, "output-data.csv", append = FALSE, col.names = FALSE,
            row.names = FALSE, quote = FALSE, sep = ",")

system("head -3 output-data.csv")
```

Vectors
```{R}
t <- c(2, 5, 7, 9.4, -1, 3)
x <- 1:3
y <- 10:12

l <- cbind(x,y)
class(l)
rbind(x,y)

r <- 1:100
cbind(x,r)
```

Creating Data Frame
```{R}
data.frame(xray)

```

creating lists
```{R}
xray <- list(ID=c("PTEN", "TERT", "CDK@NA"), Score=c(0.26, 0.20, 0.30))

xray

xray[1]

xray[[1]]

xray$ID[2]

xray[[1]][2]

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
